Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the rendering performance at the system level. The developer's explanation indicates that the 'bucket.size' is used to compute the number of buckets, generate anti-aliasing stepping sizes, and contrast thresholds, all of which are time-expensive operations. Additionally, the size of the buckets affects the distribution of work across the rendering process, leading to notable performance variations. Therefore, the 'bucket.size' configuration is considered performance-sensitive.
